alert.note: Alert for Blount; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 6:05AM CST until February 24 at 8:44PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Blount, Knox, Loudon and Sevier. * WHEN...Until 845 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 705 AM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Knoxville, Maryville, Sevierville, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Loudon, Gatlinburg, Farragut, Pigeon Forge, Louisville, Plainview, Rockford, Eagleton Village, Strawberry Plains, Halls, Blaine, Vonore, Greenback, Friendsville and Philadelphia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
